comments:
200312091137

quite regularly, after searching for references, then double clicking a result, the progress view is 
brought to top, empty of content, and annoyingly, obstructing my search view.

first problem is that the view shouldn't be brought to top if there is no content. i switched to 
'verbose' to see the reason it was popping up..

i get an error entry on 'updating workspace (system)'. clicking 'show error' says 'internal error when 
updating workspace'

second problem is perhaps this error message could use some work..

i check in the .log and see this entry (third problem..):

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Dec 10, 2003 14:24:48.821
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Updating workspace".
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: Mismatched begin/
endOperation
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:101)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.endOperation(Workspace.java:836)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1564)
        at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.events.NotificationManager$NotifyJob.run(NotificationManager.java:37)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

Progress view no longer comes to front eagerly. The internal error has not been
reproduced since and is in code that has changed significantly in the past year.
Closing.
